oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1957-11-09 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 9, 1957. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Porter Wagoner (host/performer), guest performer Mac Wiseman, and regular performers the Old Hickory Singers, Chet Atkins (who is ""just back from a big week in New York""), Rod Brasfield, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 944th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Porter Wagoner; Old Hickory Singers; Mac Wiseman; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Porter Wagoner -- Doll Face (Porter Wagoner) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Porter Wagoner) -- Porter Wagoner introduces the Old Hickory Singers -- Little Green Valley (Old Hickory Singers) -- Porter Wagoner introduces Mac Wiseman -- 'Tis Sweet To Be Remembered (Mac Wiseman) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Porter Wagoner) -- Porter Wagoner talks -- Sally Gooden -- Porter Wagoner talks -- How Beautiful Heaven Must Be (Porter Wagoner) -- Porter Wagoner introduces Chet Atkins -- Portuguese Washerwoman (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Atkins, Chet; Wood, Del; Old Hickory Singers; Wagoner, Porter; Wiseman, Mac
